Authors:
Alexandre Gon√ßalves dos Santos Silva-Filho, Marcelo
Sulzbalcher, Renato Juciano Ferreira, Iuri Goulart Baseia, Felipe
Wartchow
Title:
Lactarius taedae sp. nov. (Russulacea, Russulales): a new
unexpected sequestrate fungi from Brazil
Keywords:
ectomycorrhizal fungi, hypogeus milk caps, Pinus taeda,
rDNA ITS.
Abstract:
Data about occurrence of basidiomata forming hypogeous
sequestrate fungi in Brazil are limited and intensive studies on this
group are needed. During studies of hypogeous sequestrate fungi in Rio
Grande do Sul State, South of Brazil, an unexpected new species of
Lactarius was finding in soils of exotic Pinus plantation and here
determined based on integrative taxonomy. This new species is recognized
by the hypogeous basidiomes, reddish yellow to dark brown with a
persistent peridium and white milky latex. Microscopically is
characterized by the globose, subglobose to broadly ellipsoid
basidiospores, ornamentation forming a complete and densely reticulum
and the peridiopellis forming a cutis of repent firmly woven
hyphae.
